is used to decrease the cooldown of the attack.
is used to increase the duration of the attack.

member.name: M:Aequus.Core.Utilities.ExtendPlayer.GetPlayerFocusPosition(Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Gets the "Player Focus". This is by default the player's centre, but when using the Drone, this returns the drone's position.
This position is used to make Radon Fog disappear when approched by the player, or by their controlled drone.
This position also ignores camera panning effects, like screen shakes, scoping, ect.

member.returns: A potential dust instance, if any spawn. If none spawn, the result will be null.

member.summary: A priority for determining whether or not a new camera focus can be added

member.name: F:Aequus.Old.Common.Graphics.Camera.CameraFocus.cameraProgress
member.summary: The progress of the camera from its original position to its destination

member.name: F:Aequus.Old.Common.Graphics.Camera.CameraFocus.hold
member.summary: How long the camera holds in its target position after the caller stops running

member.name: F:Aequus.Old.Common.Graphics.Camera.CameraFocus.returning
member.summary: Whether or not the camera is returning

member.name: M:Aequus.Old.Common.Graphics.Camera.CameraFocus.SetTarget(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Aequus.Old.Common.Graphics.Camera.CameraPriority,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the camera target to a position, may return false if your priority is below a current target's priority
member.param: Context key, only really useful for 3rd party mods
A world coordinate to point the camera at
The priority of this camera target. If there is a current camera target, and its priority is above, it will prevent you from setting a target and this method will return false
The speed of the camera, the exact time it will get there is: speed / 50So 6 speed means it will get into position in 8 frames. Clamped between 6 and 25
How long the camera holds in its target position after the caller stops running
member.returns: Whether or not the camera target has been set to a new position. Spamming SetTarget will only return true on the first SetTarget call, and the rest will return false
